title: The Sex Pistols - Never Mind the Bollocks
description:
The Sex Pistols - Never Mind the Bollocks Here&#039;s the Sex Pistols  (mp3 320 Kbps)


Never Mind the Bollocks, Here&#039;s the Sex Pistols is the first and only album recorded by the Sex Pistols, a highly influential and controversial English punk band. Fans and critics alike generally regard the album as an extremely important record in the history of rock music, citing the lasting influence it&#039;s had on subsequent punk musicians.

The album was released on October 28, 1977 on the Virgin Records label,[1] amid controversy arising from the use of the obscenity (in British English) "bollocks" in its title.

Older versions of most of the album&#039;s songs also appeared on a bootleg album called Spunk, which consists of demo recordings the band had made during 1976 and January 1977, and which was released shortly before Never Mind the Bollocks.


1. Holidays in the Sun  3:22
2. Bodies  3:03 
3. No Feelings  2:51 
4. Liar  2:41 
5. Problems  4:11 
6. God Save the Queen  3:20 
7. Seventeen 2:02 
8. Anarchy in the U.K. 3:32 
9. Submission 4:12 
10. Pretty Vacant 3:18 
11. New York 3:07 
12. E.M.I. 3:10 

Johnny Rotten - lead vocals 
Steve Jones - guitar, bass, backing vocals 
Paul Cook - drums 
Glen Matlock - bass guitar and backing vocals (Anarchy in the UK)
